result.execSummary:
The defendant Van C Jackson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Van C Jackson Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Van C Jackson Jr was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Van C Jackson Jr was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Van C Jackson Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Kara M Rolf in court for Van C Jackson Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 2 and 4.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty.

03:37 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Will Rice Anderson.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
